security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. Contains only TypeScript testing pattern examples for React Native development.

content.user_title: Test React Native Apps with Jest
content.value_statement: Writing tests for React Native apps requires understanding of mocking native modules, handling async state, and testing Zustand stores. This skill provides proven patterns and code examples for reliable test suites.
actual_capabilities: Zustand store testing with proper state reset between tests
Expo module mocking patterns for Jest
React Query component testing with QueryClientProvider
Component testing with fireEvent and waitFor
limitations: Does not execute tests or interact with test runners
Does not modify project files or Jest configuration
Does not provide mock data or test fixtures
Pattern examples are for reference; users must adapt to their codebase

use_cases.title: Fix flaky store tests

use_cases.title: Mock Expo native modules
use_cases.description: Set up proper mocks for expo-router, expo-secure-store, and other Expo modules in Jest tests.

use_cases.title: Test async operations
use_cases.description: Handle async store actions and React Query data fetching in tests using act() and waitFor.

prompt_templates.title: Zustand store test

prompt_templates.title: Expo module mock
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to mock expo-router and expo-secure-store in Jest tests.

prompt_templates.title: Async test debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: My React Native tests have act() warnings and timeouts. How do I fix them?

output_examples.input: How do I test a Zustand store?
output: Reset the store before each test using setState(initialState, true) to replace (not merge) state
Use getState() to access fresh state after async operations
Wrap async store actions in act() when testing

best_practices: Always reset store state in beforeEach to prevent test pollution
Use findBy* queries instead of getBy* for async content to avoid race conditions
Mock external dependencies like expo-router at the module level for consistent behavior
anti_patterns: Using getBy* queries for async content that may not appear immediately
Forgetting to clear mocks with jest.clearAllMocks() between navigation tests
Testing implementation details instead of user-visible behavior

faq.question: Which testing frameworks does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Jest and React Native Testing Library are the primary frameworks. Patterns work with Expo and non-Expo React Native projects.

faq.question: What Jest version is required?
faq.answer: Patterns work with Jest 29+ which is standard in modern React Native projects using Expo 49 or higher.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing test setup?
faq.answer: Copy pattern examples directly into your test files. Mock configurations can be added to jest.setup.js for global availability.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that provides guidance. You manually implement patterns in your codebase.

faq.question: Why do I see act() warnings in my tests?
faq.answer: State updates occur outside act() wrapper. Use act() for async operations and waitFor() for assertions on async content.

faq.question: How is this different from rn-zustand-patterns skill?
faq.answer: rn-zustand-patterns covers implementing stores. This skill focuses specifically on testing stores, components, and hooks that use them.
